column5: Has anyone seen the new measure passed by Trudeau to restrict non Canadians from buying property in Canada for the next two years? Also, if you were to buy property in Ontario before this restriction, there is a 20% tax imposed on the sale. This is all in an effort to keep property costs down for Canadians. Seems to me that this will impact Lodge owners that are trying to sell after 2 years of the pandemic and also real estate agents selling lake properties to Americans. This is an effort to bring down property values in Vancouver and Toronto but will negatively affect NW Ontario.
I agree, there are a few camps forsale so this could make it more difficult for them.
WTF would want to move to Toronto?
It might also be intended to protect Canadians from predatory buyers that might take advantage of those who have been financially hurt by the pandemic and the lockdowns.
As long as we can still buy bait,it's all good.

idk the excact rules of what turdhead is trying to pass.. but i big big problem is multiple family foreigners buying homes that cause massive bidding wars. when you have 3-4 families purchasing 1 house and bidding against 1 family they can afford a lot more.. on a side note , i will only charge 2% if you would like me to buy something for you up here and avoid the 20% charge lol
Buy me a float plane n cabin deep in the jungle on a lake full of fish.

Being a NWO property owner, I've watched the news on this pretty carefully, and most often the language of "non-recreational residential property" is used in describing this moratorium. I think this might be language intended to exempt areas that rely on foreign investment (cottages / resorts) to keep the economy going. But that's just my guess.
Can’t blame him, look at Hawaii. Many countries don’t allow expats to buy land, some will let you buy condos but not land to build on or dwellings.
